solution_line_template: Billy took some candies and got more from his father for a total of {billy_initial}+{billy_from_father} = <<{billy_initial}+{billy_from_father}={billy_total}>>{billy_total} candies
Caleb has a total of {caleb_initial}+{caleb_from_father} = <<{caleb_initial}+{caleb_from_father}={caleb_total}>>{caleb_total} candies
Their father gave out {billy_from_father}+{caleb_from_father} = <<{billy_from_father}+{caleb_from_father}={total_given}>>{total_given} candies from a pack of {father_packet}
He gave the rest which is {father_packet}-{total_given} = <<{father_packet}-{total_given}={andy_from_father}>>{andy_from_father} candies to Andy
Andy has a total of {andy_initial}+{andy_from_father} = <<{andy_initial}+{andy_from_father}={andy_total}>>{andy_total} candies
Andy has {andy_total}-{caleb_total} = <<{andy_total}-{caleb_total}={difference_andy_caleb}>>{difference_andy_caleb} more candies than Caleb
